title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.3: HEALTH SYSTEMS STRENTHENING

description.narrative: Community monitoring systems improve the uptake of health services., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, more children, adolescents and mothers benefit from quality health interventions, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Community monitoring systems improve the uptake of health services.

description.narrative: UNICEF with all partners involved in community health supported the Ministry of Public Health in dissemination of the National Strategic Plan for Community Health to all health actors in the 26 provinces for the implementation of community-based approaches at the local level.;The CFC-RTM initiative is;experimenting, in;two health areas of Nsele Health;Zone, the;use of mobile phone through Open SRP application with automatic data collection, real time data available, and data accessible at all levels.;To date,;242 Community;Health;Workers of the two Health Areas;have been;trained in the digital community surveillance of diseases in;a context;of COVID 19; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2021
